sen.j: 皇族（こうぞく）とは、時代や国によって定義が異なるが一般的に皇帝、天皇の親族の内、男系の血族及びその配偶者。
sen.e: The definition and scope of an Imperial family depends on the historical time frame and the country concerned, but in general, it refers to the monarch, the male-line family members as well as their dependents of the Emperor's family.
The definition of an imperial family depends on the historical timeframe and the country concerned, but in general it refers to the emperor's male family members and their spouses.
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: The definition of an imperial family depends on the historical timeframe and the country concerned, but in general it refers to the emperor's male family members and their spouses.

sen.j: この項目では、日本の皇族について記述する。
sen.e: In this article, the Imperial family of Japan will be discussed.
In this article, the imperial family of Japan will be discussed.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: In this article, the imperial family of Japan will be discussed.

sen.j: 701年の大宝律令、757年の養老令など、律令には皇親（こうしん）として規定。
sen.e: Of the Ritsuryo codes such as the Taiho Ritsuryo Code of 701, the Yoro Ritsuryo Code of 757 and so on, the Imperial family is defined by the term Koshin (Emperor's family).
Of the Ritsuryo codes such as the Taiho Ritsuryo Code of 701, the Yoro Ritsuryo Code of 757 and so on, the imperial family is defined by the term Koshin (emperor's family).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: Of the Ritsuryo codes such as the Taiho Ritsuryo Code of 701, the Yoro Ritsuryo Code of 757 and so on, the imperial family is defined by the term Koshin (emperor's family).

sen.j: 俗には王氏（わうし、おうし）とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: They were commonly called 'Waushi' or 'Oushi.'
They were commonly called 'Waushi' or 'Oushi.'
They were commonly called 'Waushi' or 'Oushi.'

sen.j: 律令では、親王と王 (皇族)の別があり、とくに性別を分ける記述はないが、女性はそれぞれ、内親王、女王と称せられた。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo codes, two separate Imperial titles by the terms of Shinno (Imperial Princes) and O (Princes) are found, and although there are no descriptions alluding to the separation genders, female members of the Imperial members were each called Naishinno (Imperial Princesses) and Joo or Nyoo (Princesses).

In the Ritsuryo codes there is a distinction made between imperial princes (shinno) and princes (o); although the distinction between genders is not mentioned, women are referred to as imperial princesses (naishinno) or princesses (jyoo).
sen.cmt: 以下の文章ではそれぞれの名称はローマ字表記ではなく英語なので、ここでも統一しました。（以下同様）
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo codes there is a distinction made between imperial princes (shinno) and princes (o); although the distinction between genders is not mentioned, women are referred to as imperial princesses (naishinno) or princesses (jyoo).

sen.j: 親王号は古くは天皇の子および兄弟姉妹の称であった。
sen.e: Formerly, the title of Shinno was given to the Emperor's children and His or Her siblings upon their birth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Formerly, the title of imperial prince or princess was given to the emperor's children and siblings.
sen.cmt: 原文に「誕生の際に」とはありません。
sen.e: Formerly, the title of imperial prince or princess was given to the emperor's children and siblings.

sen.j: しかしのち親王宣下を受けたもののみに限られるようになった。
sen.e: However, later on, the right to bear the title became restricted only to those who were actually conferred the title of Imperial Prince by the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, later on, the right to bear the title became restricted only to those who were actually conferred the title by the emperor.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: However, later on, the right to bear the title became restricted only to those who were actually conferred the title by the emperor.

sen.j: 親王は品位を受け、品によって国家から給田を受けた。
sen.e: Imperial Princes would receive a hone (court rank), and would be provided rice fields from the state in accordance to their rank.
Imperial princes were given court ranks, and were provided with rice fields from the state in accordance with their rank.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。時制の修正。品位：ローマ字表記にこだわる必要はないと思い、以下全てcourt rankとしました。
sen.e: Imperial princes were given court ranks, and were provided with rice fields from the state in accordance with their rank.

sen.j: 「官位令」によれば、品位 (身位)には一品親王から四品までがあり、それぞれ国家から決められた給付を受けた。
sen.e: According to the 'Ordinance of the Court Rank,' there existed four Imperial ranks within the honi system, ranging from Ippon Shinno (the first-ranked Imperial Prince) to Shihon (the fourth-ranked Imperial Prince), and each member received a stipend that was decided by the state.
According to the 'Ordinance of the Court Ranks,' there were four imperial ranks, each receiving a stipulated stipend from the state.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるよう修正しました。大／小文字を修正しました。内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: According to the 'Ordinance of the Court Ranks,' there were four imperial ranks, each receiving a stipulated stipend from the state.

sen.j: また任官においても、八省卿（八省の長官）、大宰府帥、一部の大国の国守など、四品以上の親王に留保された官職があり、高官を保障された。
sen.e: Similarly, positions by appointment such as the minister of Hassho (the Director of Hassho), the Vice Commander of the Local Government, Provincial Governors of some of the major provinces and so on were reserved for Imperial Princes holding a rank higher than Shihon (fourth rank), and they were guaranteed a senior position.

Similarly, there were positions reserved for ranked imperial princes including minister (director) of one of the eight central ministries, vice-commander of Daizaifu or provincial governor of some major provinces, guaranteeing them senior positions.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を修正しました。読みやすいようローマ字表記よりは英語の単語を優先しました。
sen.e: Similarly, there were positions reserved for ranked imperial princes including minister (director) of one of the eight central ministries, vice-commander of Daizaifu or provincial governor of some major provinces, guaranteeing them senior positions.

sen.j: いっぽう品位をもたない親王は無品親王といった。
sen.e: On the other hand, Imperial Princes without a honi (court rank) were called Muhon-Shinno (Imperial Prince without court rank).
On the other hand, imperial princes without court ranks were called Muhon-Shinno (imperial prince without court rank).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, imperial princes without court ranks were called Muhon-Shinno (imperial prince without court rank).

sen.j: 罪を得た場合、罰として品位の剥奪が行われることがあった。
sen.e: There were cases where their court ranks (honi) were stripped as a form of punishment when Imperial Princes were found to be guilty of a crime.
There were cases where court ranks were stripped as a form of punishment when imperial princes were found to be guilty of a crime.
sen.cmt: Theirと書くと無品親王のことなので、削除しました。大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: There were cases where court ranks were stripped as a form of punishment when imperial princes were found to be guilty of a crime.

sen.j: 皇親の範囲は、「継嗣令」の規定では天皇の四世孫までが皇親とされ、五世孫は王を称したが皇孫にはあたらないとされた。
sen.e: Regarding the extent of descendants defined by the Koshin (the Emperor's family), the 'Ordinance of the Heir to the Imperial Throne' stipulates that up to the generation of the Emperor's great grandchildren (fourth generation) were deemed to be a part of the Emperor's family, and although the Emperor's great-great grandchildren (fifth generation) called themselves princes, they were not considered to be the Emperor's grandchildren.

According to the 'Ordinance of the Heir to the Imperial Throne,' the scope of Koshin is stipulated as up to and including the emperor's great-grandchildren (fourth generation); the fifth generation, or great-great-grandchildren, were called princes but not considered to be part of the imperial heritage.
sen.cmt: 読みやすく編集しました。
sen.e: According to the 'Ordinance of the Heir to the Imperial Throne,' the scope of Koshin is stipulated as up to and including the emperor's great-grandchildren (fourth generation); the fifth generation, or great-great-grandchildren, were called princes but not considered to be part of the imperial heritage.

sen.j: のち慶雲3年（706年）2月の格で、五世孫までが皇親とされ、五世孫の嫡子に王の称が許された。
sen.e: Subsequently, in the Imperial rescript given in February 706, the Emperor's great-great grandchildren (fifth generation) came to be recognized as a part of the Koshin, and the legitimate children of the great-great grandchildren were allowed to call themselves princes.

Subsequently, in the imperial rescript given in February 706, the Emperor's great-great-grandchildren (fifth generation) came to be recognized as a part of the Koshin, and the legitimate children of the great-great grandchildren were allowed to call themselves princes.
sen.cmt: “-”を進入しました。大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: Subsequently, in the imperial rescript given in February 706, the Emperor's great-great-grandchildren (fifth generation) came to be recognized as a part of the Koshin, and the legitimate children of the great-great grandchildren were allowed to call themselves princes.

sen.j: なお、近代の皇族制度とは違い、婚姻によって皇親身分を獲得したり喪失したりすることは無かった。
sen.e: Furthermore, different from the modern Imperial family system, one could not obtain or lose the status of Koshin through marriage.
Furthermore, unlike the modern imperial family system, with this system one could not obtain or lose the status of Koshin through marriage.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。制度同士を比べるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, unlike the modern imperial family system, with this system one could not obtain or lose the status of Koshin through marriage.

sen.j: 従って、光明皇后（藤原氏）のように、皇后であっても臣下の家の出身者は皇親とは認められず、逆に藤原教通室となった禔子内親王の様に臣下に降嫁後に二品叙位を受けた例も存在する（『扶桑略記』長久2年12月19日条）。
sen.e: Accordingly, such as the case for Empress Komyo, one was not recognized to be a part of the Koshin－even if that person was an Empress－when an individual came from a subject's household, but opposite cases existed, for example, where FUJIWARA no Norimichi, previously Imperial Princess Teishi, being conferred the second court rank after marrying into a subject's household.

Accordingly, even an empress was not recognized as part of the Koshin if she had come from a subject's household, as seen with Empress Komyo (Fujiwara clan), whereas one who married into a subject's household could still be conferred a court rank, as with Imperial Princess Teishi who was conferred the second court rank after she had married FUJIWARA no Norimichi (Chapter December 19, 1041, "Fuso Ryakki" [A Brief History of Japan]).
sen.cmt: “-”の前後にスペースを進入しました。時制が混在していました。内容が原文と異なっていました。『扶桑略記』長久2年12月19日条が抜けていました。
sen.e: Accordingly, even an empress was not recognized as part of the Koshin if she had come from a subject's household, as seen with Empress Komyo (Fujiwara clan), whereas one who married into a subject's household could still be conferred a court rank, as with Imperial Princess Teishi who was conferred the second court rank after she had married FUJIWARA no Norimichi (Chapter December 19, 1041, "Fuso Ryakki" [A Brief History of Japan]).

sen.j: 令では、皇親でないものは、姓を賜って臣に下ることが規定されていた。
sen.e: According to the 'Ordinance of the Heir to the Imperial Throne,' it was stipulated that members not a part of the Emperor's family to be demoted to the subject's rank by being bestowed a family name.
The ordinance stipulated that those who were not part of the Koshin were bestowed a family name and demoted to the rank of subject.
sen.cmt: 読みやすくなるよう簡潔にしました。
sen.e: The ordinance stipulated that those who were not part of the Koshin were bestowed a family name and demoted to the rank of subject.

sen.j: 最初の賜姓がいつであったかはさだかでないが、初期の賜姓皇族として橘氏がある。
sen.e: The timing of the first shisei (bestowing a surname) is unclear, but the Tachibana clan is known as one of the initial clans of the Imperial family conferred with a family name.
The timing of the first shisei (bestowing a surname) is unclear, but the Tachibana clan is known as one of the initial clans of the Imperial family conferred with a family name.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: The timing of the first shisei (bestowing a surname) is unclear, but the Tachibana clan is known as one of the initial clans of the Imperial family conferred with a family name.

sen.j: 敏達天皇の子孫であった葛城王（橘諸兄）と佐為王（橘佐為）は、聖武天皇の天平8年（736年）に臣籍降下を申し出た。
sen.e: The descendants of Emperor Bidatsu, Prince Kazuraki (TACHIBANA no Moroe) and Sai no Okimi (TACHIBANA no Sai) requested to be demoted from their nobility status to that of a subject.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The descendants of Emperor Bidatsu, Prince Kazuraki (TACHIBANA no Moroe) and Sai no Okimi (TACHIBANA no Sai) requested to be demoted from nobility to regular subjects.
sen.cmt: 臣籍降下をより簡潔に訳しました。
sen.e: The descendants of Emperor Bidatsu, Prince Kazuraki (TACHIBANA no Moroe) and Sai no Okimi (TACHIBANA no Sai) requested to be demoted from nobility to regular subjects.

sen.j: そして母県犬養三千代の氏姓を願い、橘宿禰の氏（うじ）・姓（かばね）を賜った。
sen.e: Then they desired to be granted their mother's family name, Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo, and received the kabane (hereditary title) of Sukune and the clan title of TACHIBANA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then they desired to be granted the family name of their mother, Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo, and received the kabane (hereditary title) of TACHIBANA no Sukune.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるよう修正しました。
sen.e: Then they desired to be granted the family name of their mother, Agata no INUKAI no Michiyo, and received the kabane (hereditary title) of TACHIBANA no Sukune.

sen.j: のち、平安初期以降、皇親を減らして国家の支出を減らす、皇位争いに関する政争を除く、皇室の藩屏となる高級貴族をおくなどの目的で、多くの臣籍降下が行われた。
sen.e: Subsequently, after the early Heian Period, numerous cases of demotions from nobility status to that of a subject took place with the aim to reduce the state's expenditure by lessening the numbers of Koshin; to remove the political infighting concerning the succession to the Imperial throne; and to create high-ranking nobilities that would serve as a buffer between the Imperial family.

Subsequently, after the early Heian Period, there were numerous demotions from nobility to subject status with the aim to reduce the state's expenditure by decreasing the number of Koshin, to remove the political infighting concerning the succession to the imperial throne, and to create high-ranking nobilities that would serve as a buffer for the imperial family.
sen.cmt: 臣籍降下をより簡潔に訳しました。Lessening→decreasing動詞を修正しました。
sen.e: Subsequently, after the early Heian Period, there were numerous demotions from nobility to subject status with the aim to reduce the state's expenditure by decreasing the number of Koshin, to remove the political infighting concerning the succession to the imperial throne, and to create high-ranking nobilities that would serve as a buffer for the imperial family.

sen.j: 後一条天皇の時、皇太子敦明親王が皇太子辞退を申し出ると、親王の男子（三条天皇の孫）に特に親王の称号を許して以後厳密な規定がされなくなり、孫以下の皇親でも天皇の養子縁組・猶子となって親王の待遇を受ける事が可能となった。
sen.e: When the Crown Prince Atsuakira requested to withdraw from the Crown Princeship during the reign of Emperor Goichijo, the title of shinny (Imperial Prince) was specially granted to the grandson of Emperor Sanjo (son of an Imperial Prince) which lifted the strict measures regarding entitlement; this made it possible even for grandchildren and those generations beyond (of the Emperor's family) to be able to receive the rights granted to Imperial Princes by becoming the adopted child of the Emperor.

When Crown Prince Atsuakira requested to withdraw from the crown princeship during the reign of Emperor Goichijo, the title of imperial prince was specially granted to the crown prince's son (grandson of Emperor Sanjo), lifting the strict measures regarding entitlement and allowing Koshin two generations and beyond to be able to receive the rights granted to imperial princes by becoming the adopted child of an emperor.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を修正しました。大／小文字を修正しました。説明を分かりやすくしました。内容が原文と異なっていました。
sen.e: When Crown Prince Atsuakira requested to withdraw from the crown princeship during the reign of Emperor Goichijo, the title of imperial prince was specially granted to the crown prince's son (grandson of Emperor Sanjo), lifting the strict measures regarding entitlement and allowing Koshin two generations and beyond to be able to receive the rights granted to imperial princes by becoming the adopted child of an emperor.

sen.j: 後にこれが世襲化されたのが世襲親王家のルーツと言われている。
sen.e: Subsequently, what became a formalized practice of the hereditary system arising from this event is said to be the beginning of the hereditary system for the houses of princes.
The hereditary system which subsequently arose from this event is said to be the beginning of the hereditary houses of princes.
The hereditary system which subsequently arose from this event is said to be the beginning of the hereditary houses of princes.

sen.j: 江戸時代以降、世襲親王家世襲親王家（四親王家）から構成されるようになった。
sen.e: After the Edo Period, the hereditary system for the houses of princes begun to be comprised of the Four Imperial Houses of Princes (Shitennoke).
After the Edo Period, the hereditary houses of princes consisted of the Four Imperial Houses of Princes (Shitennoke).
sen.cmt: 「世襲親王家世襲親王家（四親王家）」をWebで確認すると、世襲親王家はリンク先の用語のようです。ここでは、「世襲親王家が四親王家から校正されるようになったと解釈しております。」
sen.e: After the Edo Period, the hereditary houses of princes consisted of the Four Imperial Houses of Princes (Shitennoke).

sen.j: 伏見宮、有栖川宮、桂宮（現在の桂宮家とは無関係）、閑院宮の四宮家は世襲親王家として代々各宮家の王 (皇族)が天皇の猶子（養子の一種）となり、親王宣下を受け世襲した。
sen.e: As an Imperial household that practiced the installment of imperial princes through the hereditary system for generations, an O (prince) from each household of the Four Houses of Imperial Princes (Miyake) comprised of Fushimi no Miya, Arisugawa no Miya, Katsura no Miya (no relation to the current Katsura no Miya), and Kanin no Miya, would become the adopted son of the Emperor, and would be given the title of shinny (Imperial Prince), thus furthering the tradition of the hereditary system.

A prince from each of the Four Imperial Houses of Princes (also called Miyake) comprised of Fushimi no Miya, Arisugawa no Miya, Katsura no Miya (no relation to the current Katsura no Miya) and Kanin no Miya was adopted by the emperor and conferred the title of imperial prince in order to inherit the throne.

A prince from each of the Four Imperial Houses of Princes (also called Miyake) comprised of Fushimi no Miya, Arisugawa no Miya, Katsura no Miya (no relation to the current Katsura no Miya) and Kanin no Miya was adopted by the emperor and conferred the title of imperial prince in order to inherit the throne.

sen.j: 大日本帝国憲法下では旧皇室典範によってその範囲を定められた、皇統に属する天皇の一族を皇族とする。
sen.e: Under the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, pursuant to the extent defined by the Former Imperial House Act, the Imperial family is defined as the family of the Emperor that shares the Imperial lineage.

Under the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, pursuant to the extent defined by the Former Imperial House Act, the Imperial family was defined as the family of the emperor that shared his Imperial lineage.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。冠詞を修正しました。
sen.e: Under the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, pursuant to the extent defined by the Former Imperial House Act, the Imperial family was defined as the family of the emperor that shared his Imperial lineage.

sen.j: 天皇は皇族に含めない。
sen.e: The Emperor is not included in the Imperial family.
The emperor was not a member of the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: The emperor was not a member of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 天皇と皇族をあわせた全体を皇室という。
sen.e: The combined whole of the Emperor and the Imperial family is called the Imperial Household of Japan.
The combined whole of the emperor and the Imperial family was called the Imperial Household.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。Of Japanを削除しました。
sen.e: The combined whole of the emperor and the Imperial family was called the Imperial Household.

sen.j: 皇族の構成員は、皇后・太皇太后・皇太后・皇太子・皇太子妃・皇太孫・皇太孫妃・親王・親王妃・内親王・王 (皇族)・王妃 (皇族)・女王 (皇族)である（旧皇室典範30条）。
sen.e: The constituent members of the Imperial family are comprised of: the Empress (Kogo), the Grand Empress Dowager (Taikotaigo), the Empress Dowager (Kotaigo), the Crown Prince (Kotaishi), the Crown Princess (Kotashihi), the son of the Crown Prince (Kotaison), the consort of the son of the Crown Prince (Kotaisonhi), Imperial Princes (Shinno), the consort of an Imperial Prince (Shinnohi), Imperial Princesses (Naishinno), Princes (O), Empresses (Ohi), Queens (Joo or Nyoo) (Article 30 of the Former Imperial House Act).

The constituent members of the Imperial family were: the empress (Kogo), the grand empress dowager (Taikotaigo), the empress dowager (Kotaigo), the crown prince (Kotaishi), the crown princess (Kotashihi), the (eldest) son of the crown prince (Kotaison), the consort of the son of the crown prince (Kotaisonhi), imperial princes (Shinno), the consorts of imperial princes (Shinnohi), imperial princesses (Naishinno), princes (O),the consorts of princes (Ohi), princesses (Jyoo) (Article 30 of the Former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。皇后との混乱を防ぐため、王妃はconsort of prince、女王はprincessとしました。
sen.e: The constituent members of the Imperial family were: the empress (Kogo), the grand empress dowager (Taikotaigo), the empress dowager (Kotaigo), the crown prince (Kotaishi), the crown princess (Kotashihi), the (eldest) son of the crown prince (Kotaison), the consort of the son of the crown prince (Kotaisonhi), imperial princes (Shinno), the consorts of imperial princes (Shinnohi), imperial princesses (Naishinno), princes (O),the consorts of princes (Ohi), princesses (Jyoo) (Article 30 of the Former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: また、皇室親族令により、姻族の範囲は3親等内と規定された。
sen.e: Furthermore, the extent defined by the Ordinance of the Family of the Imperial Household recognized a relative within the third degree of relationship to hold the status as the Emperor's relative by marriage.

Furthermore, the extent defined by the Ordinance of the Family of the Imperial Household recognized a relative within the third degree of relationship to hold the status as the Emperor's relative by marriage.

Furthermore, the extent defined by the Ordinance of the Family of the Imperial Household recognized a relative within the third degree of relationship to hold the status as the Emperor's relative by marriage.

sen.j: 律令制の元で皇親と呼ばれていた呼称に変えて、「皇族」という呼称を採用した。
sen.e: The term 'Kozoku' (Imperial family) was adopted in place of 'Koshin' (Emperor's family) which was a term used under the Ritsuryo Code system.
The term 'Kozoku' was adopted in place of 'Koshin' which was used under the Ritsuryo Code system.
sen.cmt: 既に説明済みだったので、ローマ字表記のみにしました。
sen.e: The term 'Kozoku' was adopted in place of 'Koshin' which was used under the Ritsuryo Code system.

sen.j: また、旧来は皇后と言えども臣下の家に生まれた場合には「皇親」とは認められなかったが、この改正によって皇后・妃なども皇族として扱われるようになった。
sen.e: In the old days, even the Empress was not recognized as a part of the 'Koshin' in the case of being born in a subject's household, but due the revisions made under the Meiji Constitution, the Empress and consorts as well as others begun to be treated as a part of the Imperial family.

Previously, not even an empress was recognized as a part of the 'Koshin' if born into a subject's family; however, due to revisions made in the Meiji Constitution, an empress and other consorts were all treated as part of the Imperial family.

Previously, not even an empress was recognized as a part of the 'Koshin' if born into a subject's family; however, due to revisions made in the Meiji Constitution, an empress and other consorts were all treated as part of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 現行憲法下と違い、四世孫（皇親族）までが親王・内親王とされ、五世孫以下が王・女王とされていた（旧皇室典範31条）。
sen.e: Different from the existing Constitution, the generation up to the great grandchildren (fourth generation) were called Shinno (an Imperial Prince) and Naishinno (an Imperial Princess), and the generations beyond the great-great grandchildren (fifth generation) were called O (Prince) or Jo or Nyoo (Princess) (Article 31 of the Former Imperial House Act).

Unlike the existing constitution, the title imperial prince/princess was given to those down to the great-grandchildren of the emperor, and great-great-grandchildren and later generations were given the title prince or princess (Article 31 of the former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。ローマ字表記を削除しました。
sen.e: Unlike the existing constitution, the title imperial prince/princess was given to those down to the great-grandchildren of the emperor, and great-great-grandchildren and later generations were given the title prince or princess (Article 31 of the former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: また、非嫡出子も皇族とされた。
sen.e: Furthermore, illegitimate children were considered as a part of the Imperial family.
Furthermore, illegitimate children were also considered part of the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 不要なas aを削除しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, illegitimate children were also considered part of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 旧皇室典範により、成年（皇太子・皇太孫は満18歳。その他の皇族は満20歳。）に達した皇族の男子は、皇室内の事項について天皇の諮詢を受ける皇族会議の議員となった。
sen.e: By the decree of the Former Imperial House Act, any male members of the Imperial family who have reached their majority (the Crown Prince and the son of the Crown Prince had to be over 18. Other Imperial family members had to be over 20.) became a councilor on the Imperial Family Council, a body consulted by the Emperor on matters regarding the Imperial household.

By the decree of the former Imperial House Act, any male member of the Imperial family who reached the age of majority (18 for the crown prince or the son of the crown prince, 20 for other members of the Imperial family) became a councilor on the Imperial Family Council, a body consulted by the emperor on matters regarding the Imperial household.
sen.cmt: 成年するをreach the age of majorityとしました。大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: By the decree of the former Imperial House Act, any male member of the Imperial family who reached the age of majority (18 for the crown prince or the son of the crown prince, 20 for other members of the Imperial family) became a councilor on the Imperial Family Council, a body consulted by the emperor on matters regarding the Imperial household.

sen.j: 明治21年(1888年)5月18日の勅命により、成年に達した親王は、枢密院 (日本)の会議に班列（列席して議事に参加すること）する権利を有した。
sen.e: The Imperial order decreed on May 18th, 1888, gave the Imperial Princes who have reached their majority the right to attend the meeting of the Privy Council (of Japan's) as Minister-without-Portfolio (and to participate in the proceedings).

The Imperial order decreed on May 18th, 1888, gave imperial princes who had reached the age of majority the right to attend (and participate in) meetings of the Privy Council (Japan) as Minister-without-Portfolio.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。単数→複数に修正しました。Of ~'sを削除しました。
sen.e: The Imperial order decreed on May 18th, 1888, gave imperial princes who had reached the age of majority the right to attend (and participate in) meetings of the Privy Council (Japan) as Minister-without-Portfolio.

sen.j: 貴族院令により、成年に達した皇族の男子は自動的に貴族院 (日本)における皇族議員となった。
sen.e: By the promulgation of the Imperial Ordinance Concerning the House of Peers, male members of the Imperial family who reached their majority automatically became an Imperial councilor of the Privy Council (of Japan's).

By the promulgation of the Imperial Ordinance Concerning the House of Peers, male members of the Imperial family who had reached the age of majority automatically became an Imperial councilor of the Privy Council (Japan).
sen.cmt: Of ~'sを削除しました。時制を修正しました。
sen.e: By the promulgation of the Imperial Ordinance Concerning the House of Peers, male members of the Imperial family who had reached the age of majority automatically became an Imperial councilor of the Privy Council (Japan).

sen.j: だが、皇族が政争に関与すべきではないこと、皇族は武官であったことから、登院は極めて稀であった。
sen.e: However, from the standpoint that a member of the Imperial family should not be involved in politics and from the fact that they were military officers, it was rear for them to attend the Council.
However, from the standpoint that members of the Imperial family should not be involved in politics and the fact that they were military officers, it was rare for them to actually attend the Council.
sen.cmt: 単数を複数に変えました。綴りを修正しました。強調するため、actuallyを追加しました。
sen.e: However, from the standpoint that members of the Imperial family should not be involved in politics and the fact that they were military officers, it was rare for them to actually attend the Council.

sen.j: 皇族身位令（皇室令。既に廃止）によって、次の区分に従って叙勲された。
sen.e: By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility (the Ordinance of the Imperial House, abolished), orders were bestowed in accordance with the following classification:
By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility (the Ordinance of the Imperial House, abolished), orders were bestowed in accordance with the following classifications:
sen.cmt: 単数を複数に変えました。
sen.e: By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility (the Ordinance of the Imperial House, abolished), orders were bestowed in accordance with the following classifications:

sen.j: 皇后：勲一等宝冠章‐大婚の約がなったとき。
sen.e: the Empress (Kogo): the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho) was bestowed upon engagement with the Emperor.
The Empress: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), upon engagement with the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。
sen.e: The Empress: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), upon engagement with the Emperor.

sen.j: 皇太子・皇太孫：大勲位菊花大綬章‐満7歳に達した後。
sen.e: The Crown Prince (Kotaishi) and the son of the Crown Prince (Kotaison): Upon their 7th birthday, they were bestowed the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
The Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince: the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum, upon their seventh birthdays.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。 原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince: the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum, upon their seventh birthdays.

sen.j: 皇太子妃・皇太孫妃：勲一等宝冠章‐結婚の約がなったとき。
sen.e: The Crown Princess (Kotaishihi) and the consort of the son of the Crown Prince (Kotaisonhi): Upon engagement with the Crown Prince or the son of the Crown Prince, they were bestowed the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho).

The Consort of the Crown Prince and the Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), upon engagement with the Crown Prince or a son of the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。内親王と区別するため、皇太子妃はconsort of the crown princeとしました。
sen.e: The Consort of the Crown Prince and the Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), upon engagement with the Crown Prince or a son of the Crown Prince.

sen.j: 親王：大勲位菊花大綬章‐満15歳に達した後。
sen.e: Imperial Princes (Shinno): Upon their 15th birthday, they were bestowed the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum.
Imperial Princes: the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum, upon their 15th birthdays.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。15thの上付きをとりました。
sen.e: Imperial Princes: the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum, upon their 15th birthdays.

sen.j: 親王妃：勲一等宝冠章‐結婚の礼を行う当日。
sen.e: Consorts of Imperial Princes (Shinnohi): On the day of the wedding ceremony, she was bestowed the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho).
Consorts of Imperial Princes: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), on the day of the wedding ceremonies.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Consorts of Imperial Princes: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), on the day of the wedding ceremonies.

sen.j: 内親王：勲一等宝冠章‐満15歳に達した後。
sen.e: Imperial Princesses (Naishinno): Upon their 15th birthday, they were bestowed the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho).
Imperial Princesses: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), upon their 15th birthdays.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。15thの上付きをとりました。
sen.e: Imperial Princesses: the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho), upon their 15th birthdays.

sen.j: 王 (皇族)：勲一等旭日桐花大綬章‐満15歳に達した後。
sen.e: Princes (O): Upon their 15th birthday, they were bestowed the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower.
Princes: the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower, upon their 15th birthdays.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。15thの上付きをとりました。
sen.e: Princes: the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower, upon their 15th birthdays.

sen.j: 王妃 (皇族)：勲二等宝冠章‐結婚の礼を行う当日。
sen.e: Empresses (Ohi): The day of their wedding ceremony, they were bestowed the Order of the Precious Crown Second Class.
Consorts of Princes: the Order of the Precious Crown Second Class, on the day of their wedding ceremonies.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。皇后と区別するため、Consort of princeとしました。
sen.e: Consorts of Princes: the Order of the Precious Crown Second Class, on the day of their wedding ceremonies.

sen.j: 女王 (皇族)：勲二等宝冠章‐満15歳に達した後。
sen.e: Queens (Joo or Nyoo): Upon reaching their 15th birthday, they were bestowed the Order of the Precious Crown Second Order.
Princesses: the Order of the Precious Crown Second Order, upon their 15th birthdays.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。原文と同じよう簡潔にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。15thの上付きをとりました。
sen.e: Princesses: the Order of the Precious Crown Second Order, upon their 15th birthdays.

tit.cmt: 単数を複数に変えました。

sen.j: 皇族身位令によって、次の区分に従って任官された。
sen.e: By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility, members of the Imperial family were given positions by appointment in accordance to the following classification:
By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility, members of the Imperial family were given positions by appointment in accordance to the following classifications:
sen.cmt: 単数を複数に変えました。
sen.e: By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility, members of the Imperial family were given positions by appointment in accordance to the following classifications:

sen.j: 皇太子・皇太孫‐満10歳に達した後に陸軍及び海軍の武官。
sen.e: The Crown Prince (Kotaishi) and the son of the Crown Prince (Kotaison): After reaching the age of 10, they were appointed as a military officer of the Army and Navy.
The Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince: military officer of the Army and Navy, upon their tenth birthdays
sen.cmt: 前部と同一性を保つよう編集しました。
sen.e: The Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince: military officer of the Army and Navy, upon their tenth birthdays

sen.j: 親王・王‐満18歳に達した後に、原則、陸軍又は海軍の武官。
sen.e: Imperial Princes (Shinno) and Princes (O): In principal, after reaching the age of 18, they were appointed as a military officer of the Army and Navy.
Imperial Princes and Princes: in principle, military officer of the Army or Navy upon their 18th birthdays.
sen.cmt: 前部と同一性を保つよう編集しました。又は＝or綴りを修正しました。18thの上付きをとりました。
sen.e: Imperial Princes and Princes: in principle, military officer of the Army or Navy upon their 18th birthdays.

tit.e: Trying Members of the Imperial Family
tit.cmt: 皇族全体ではなく、個人という意味に変えました。
tit.e: Trying Members of the Imperial Family

tit.cmt: 単数を複数に変えました。

sen.j: 皇族相互間の民事訴訟については、特別裁判所として皇室裁判所が臨時に必要に応じて置かれ、これが裁判管轄することになっていた。
sen.e: Regarding civil suits arising between the Imperial family members, an Imperial courthouse was temporarily created as a special tribunal, and this authority had the jurisdiction over the proceedings.
For civil suits arising between Imperial family members, an Imperial courthouse was established as required as a special tribunal with jurisdiction over the proceedings.
sen.cmt: 冠詞を修正しました。自然な表現に直しました。
sen.e: For civil suits arising between Imperial family members, an Imperial courthouse was established as required as a special tribunal with jurisdiction over the proceedings.

sen.j: 他方、皇族と人民（臣民）の間の民事訴訟については、人民の皇族に対する民事訴訟の第一審と第二審が東京裁判所大日本帝国憲法（旧憲法）下の裁判所の管轄に属することとされたこと等の外は、一般の法令によるものとされた。
sen.e: On the other hand, for civil suits arising between the Imperial family and the general public (subjects), other than the fact that the first and second instances in the proceedings of civil suits filed against the Imperial family came under the jurisdiction of the court under the Tokyo Court of the Constitution of the Empire of Japan (Meiji Constitution), all other proceedings were tried under the general law.

On the other hand, for civil suits arising between members of the Imperial family and the general public, the first and second proceedings of civil suits filed against the Imperial family came under the jurisdiction of the court appointed by the Constitution of the Empire of Japan (Meiji Constitution), and all other proceedings were conducted as per general law.
sen.cmt: 原文に誤りがあると思われます：「東京裁判所大日本帝国憲法（旧憲法）下の裁判所の管轄に属すること」の関係が分かりません。皇族全体ではなく、個人という意味に変えました。Tried→conducted (proceedingはtryできません）
sen.e: On the other hand, for civil suits arising between members of the Imperial family and the general public, the first and second proceedings of civil suits filed against the Imperial family came under the jurisdiction of the court appointed by the Constitution of the Empire of Japan (Meiji Constitution), and all other proceedings were conducted as per general law.

tit.cmt: 単数を複数に変えました。

sen.j: 皇族の刑事訴訟については、軍法会議の裁判権に属するものを除く外は、大審院の管轄に属するものとされた。
sen.e: Regarding criminal suits of the Imperial family, matters not under the administration of justice of court martial came under the jurisdiction of the Daishin-in (predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).

Regarding criminal suits involving the Imperial family, matters that did not fall under the jurisdiction of court martial came under that of the Daishin-in (predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).

Regarding criminal suits involving the Imperial family, matters that did not fall under the jurisdiction of court martial came under that of the Daishin-in (predecessor of the Supreme Court of Japan).

sen.j: 軍法会議の裁判権に属するものについては、高等軍法会議で審判された。
sen.e: Matters under the jurisdiction of court martial was tried at the general court martial.
Matters under the jurisdiction of court martial were tried at the general court martial.
Matters under the jurisdiction of court martial were tried at the general court martial.

tit.e: Privileges and Obligations of the Imperial Family
Privileges and Obligations of the Imperial Family
Privileges and Obligations of the Imperial Family

sen.j: 皇族男子は皇位継承資格を、親王妃と王妃を除いた成年に達した皇族は摂政就任資格をもつ。
sen.e: Male members of the Imperial family were qualified to succeed the Imperial Throne, and excepting consorts of Imperial Princes (Shinnohi) and Princes (Empresses, otherwise known as Ohi), members of the Imperial family that have reached their majority were qualified to assume the role of Sessho (regent).

Male members of the Imperial family were qualified to succeed the Imperial Throne, and excepting consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes, all members of the Imperial family that had reached the age of majority were qualified to assume the role of Sessho (regent).
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。Age of majorityと修正しました。
sen.e: Male members of the Imperial family were qualified to succeed the Imperial Throne, and excepting consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes, all members of the Imperial family that had reached the age of majority were qualified to assume the role of Sessho (regent).

sen.j: 皇后・太皇太后・皇太后は陛下、それ以外の皇族は殿下の敬称を称した（旧皇室典範17,18条）。
sen.e: The Empress, the Grand Empress Dowager, and the Empress Dowager were addressed by the title of honor of Her Imperial Majesty, and all other Imperial family members were addressed by the title of honor of His or Her Imperial Highness (Articles 17 and 18 of the Former Imperial House Act).

The Empress, the Grand Empress Dowager, and the Empress Dowager were addressed by the title Her Majesty, and all other Imperial family members were addressed by the title of His or Her Imperial Highness (Articles 17 and 18 of the former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。不要な箇所を削除しました。
sen.e: The Empress, the Grand Empress Dowager, and the Empress Dowager were addressed by the title Her Majesty, and all other Imperial family members were addressed by the title of His or Her Imperial Highness (Articles 17 and 18 of the former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族は天皇の監督を受けた（旧皇室典範35条）。
sen.e: The Imperial family was supervised by the Emperor (Article 35 of the Former Imperial House Act).
The Imperial family was supervised by the Emperor (Article 35 of the former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: The Imperial family was supervised by the Emperor (Article 35 of the former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族の後見人は、成年以上の皇族に限られた（旧皇室典範38条）。
sen.e: The guardian of the Imperial family was limited to those members of the Imperial family who had reached their majority (Article 38 of the Former Imperial House Act).
Only Imperial family members who had reached the age of majority were allowed to take on the role of guardian of another member of the Imperial family (Article 38 of the Former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 皇族全体ではなく、個人という意味に変えました。
sen.e: Only Imperial family members who had reached the age of majority were allowed to take on the role of guardian of another member of the Imperial family (Article 38 of the Former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族の結婚は、皇族同士か特に勅許を受けた華族との間に限られ、勅許を必要とした（旧皇室典範39,40条）。
sen.e: Marriage for members in the Imperial family required an Imperial sanction, and it was restricted either to those between the Imperial family members or the peerage upon receipt of a special Imperial sanction (Articles 39 and 40 of the Former Imperial House Act).

Marriage for members in the Imperial family required an Imperial sanction, and they were only allowed to marry other members of the Imperial family or, with special Imperial sanction, members of the peerage (Articles 39 and 40 of the former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 後半をより自然な英語に修正しました。大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: Marriage for members in the Imperial family required an Imperial sanction, and they were only allowed to marry other members of the Imperial family or, with special Imperial sanction, members of the peerage (Articles 39 and 40 of the former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: また、大正7年（1918年）11月28日皇室典範増補により、皇族女子は王公族（旧韓国皇室）に嫁することができた。
sen.e: Furthermore, due to the supplementation to the Imperial House Act on November 28th, 1918, female members of the Imperial family were allowed to wed the O Imperial Family (the Imperial Household of the Former Republic of Korea).

Furthermore, due to the supplementation to the Imperial House Act on November 28th, 1918, female members of the Imperial family were allowed to marry into the O Imperial Family (the Imperial Household of the former Republic of Korea).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。「公族と結婚する」を「公族に嫁ぐ」と変えました。
sen.e: Furthermore, due to the supplementation to the Imperial House Act on November 28th, 1918, female members of the Imperial family were allowed to marry into the O Imperial Family (the Imperial Household of the former Republic of Korea).

sen.j: 皇族の養子縁組は禁止された（旧皇室典範42条）。
sen.e: Adoption by the Imperial family was banned (Article 42 of the Former Imperial House Act).
Adoption by the Imperial family was banned (Article 42 of the former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。
sen.e: Adoption by the Imperial family was banned (Article 42 of the former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族の国外旅行には勅許を必要とした（旧皇室典範43条）。
sen.e: An Imperial sanction was necessary for any overseas trips (Article 43 of the Former Imperial House Act).
An Imperial sanction was necessary for any overseas trips taken by members of the Imperial family (Article 43 of the former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。「皇族の」を追加しました。
sen.e: An Imperial sanction was necessary for any overseas trips taken by members of the Imperial family (Article 43 of the former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族を勾引し、裁判所に召喚するには勅許を必要とした（旧皇室典範51条）。
sen.e: An Imperial sanction was necessary for the arrest and summoning of the Imperial family to the court of law (Article 51 of the Former Imperial House Act).
An Imperial sanction was necessary for the arrest of or summoning to court of a member of the Imperial family (Article 51 of the former Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。順序を正しました。
sen.e: An Imperial sanction was necessary for the arrest of or summoning to court of a member of the Imperial family (Article 51 of the former Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族が品位を辱める行いをしたり、皇室に対して忠順を欠くときは勅旨を以って懲戒を受け、重い場合は皇族特権の停止、剥奪を受け、臣籍に降されることもあることになっていた（旧皇室典範52条・明治40年-1907年-2月11日皇室典範増補4条）。
sen.e: For actions that disgraced their honi or for a lack of loyalty towards the Imperial household, members of the Imperial family were given a reprimand by an Imperial statement, and for egregious cases, there were possibilities of the suspension and the deprivation of their Imperial privileges as well as demotions to the status of a subject (Article 52 of the Former Imperial House Act and Article 4 of the Supplement to the Imperial House Act, February 11, 1907).

For actions that disgraced their court ranks or for a lack of loyalty towards the Imperial household, members of the Imperial family were given a reprimand by way of an Imperial statement, and for egregious cases, there were possibilities of the suspension or deprivation of their Imperial privileges, or even demotions to the status of a subject (Article 52 of the former Imperial House Act and Article 4 of the Supplement to the Imperial House Act, February 11, 1907).
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。停止「と」剥奪の代わりに停止「か」剥奪としました。
sen.e: For actions that disgraced their court ranks or for a lack of loyalty towards the Imperial household, members of the Imperial family were given a reprimand by way of an Imperial statement, and for egregious cases, there were possibilities of the suspension or deprivation of their Imperial privileges, or even demotions to the status of a subject (Article 52 of the former Imperial House Act and Article 4 of the Supplement to the Imperial House Act, February 11, 1907).

sen.j: 王は、勅旨又は情願によって華族となることができた（臣籍降下）。
sen.e: An O (Prince) was able to become a member of the peerage by an Imperial statement or through petition (demotion to the status of a subject).
A prince was able to become a member of the peerage by an Imperial statement or through petition (demotion to the status of a subject).
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。
sen.e: A prince was able to become a member of the peerage by an Imperial statement or through petition (demotion to the status of a subject).

sen.j: また、勅許によって華族の家督を相続することや、家督相続の目的で華族の養子となることができた。
sen.e: Furthermore, through an Imperial sanction, they were able to inherit the peerage's estate as well as become the adopted son for the purpose of inheritance.
Furthermore, through an Imperial sanction, they were able to inherit the estate of a member of the peerage or become the adopted son of a member for the purpose of succeeding a family.
sen.cmt: Peerageの使い方を修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, through an Imperial sanction, they were able to inherit the estate of a member of the peerage or become the adopted son of a member for the purpose of succeeding a family.

sen.j: （明治40年-1907年-2月11日皇室典範増補1,2条）
sen.e: (Articles 1 and 2 of the Supplement to the Imperial House Act of February 11, 1907).
(Articles 1 and 2 of the Supplement to the Imperial House Act of February 11, 1907).
(Articles 1 and 2 of the Supplement to the Imperial House Act of February 11, 1907).

sen.j: 宮家を賜った皇族には、別当・家令・家扶・家従といった職員が附属された。
sen.e: For the Imperial family that was given the status of a Miyake (families allowed to have the status of Imperial family), they were given a betto (superintendent), a karei (butler), a kafu (steward) and a kaju (attendant) as household workers.
Imperial families with the status of Imperial House of Princes were assigned household workers such as a superintendent, a butler, a steward and attendants.
sen.cmt: 既に紹介済みのローマ字表記は削除しました。簡潔にしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Imperial families with the status of Imperial House of Princes were assigned household workers such as a superintendent, a butler, a steward and attendants.

sen.j: また、武官である皇族には、侍従武官（佐尉官）が附属された。
sen.e: Also, for military officers that were members of the Imperial family, a military attaché to the palace (officer below the rank of major) was provided.
Also, members of the Imperial family that were military officers were assigned a military attaché to the palace (officer below the rank of major).
sen.cmt: 上文と同じスタイルにしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Also, members of the Imperial family that were military officers were assigned a military attaché to the palace (officer below the rank of major).

sen.j: 皇族は満6歳から満20歳まで普通教育を受けるものとされ、原則として学習院又は女子学習院で就学するものとされた（皇族就学令）。
sen.e: Members of the Imperial family over the age of 6 until the age of 20 received general education, and in principal, they were educated at The Gakushuin or at the Gakushuin Girl's Junior and Senior High School (Ordinance of the Education of the Imperial Family).

Members of the Imperial family received mandatory general education between the ages of 6 and 20, and as a rule attended the Gakushuin Boys' and Girls' Schools(Ordinance of the Education of the Imperial Family).
sen.cmt: Principalは綴りミスです。Over the age~では10歳開始でもいいという意味になってしまうので、表現を変えました。
sen.e: Members of the Imperial family received mandatory general education between the ages of 6 and 20, and as a rule attended the Gakushuin Boys' and Girls' Schools(Ordinance of the Education of the Imperial Family).

tit.e: Imperial Ranking Order of the Imperial Family
Order of Ranks of the Imperial Family
tit.cmt: Imperialを２回書く必要はないと思います。
tit.e: Order of Ranks of the Imperial Family

sen.j: 皇族の班位（順位）は、皇族身位令により、次の順序によるものとされた。
sen.e: By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility, the Imperial ranking order of the Imperial family were given in the following order:
By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility, Imperial family members were ranked in the following order:
sen.cmt: Imperialを２回書く必要はないと思います。不要なスペースを削除しました。より自然な英語にしました。
sen.e: By the decree of the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility, Imperial family members were ranked in the following order:

sen.j: 皇后
sen.e: The Empress
The Empress
The Empress

sen.j: 太皇太后
sen.e: The Grand Empress Dowager
The Grand Empress Dowager
The Grand Empress Dowager

sen.j: 皇太后
sen.e: The Empress Dowager
The Empress Dowager
The Empress Dowager

sen.j: 皇太子
sen.e: The Crown Prince
The Crown Prince
The Crown Prince

sen.j: 皇太子妃
sen.e: The Crown Princess
The Consort of the Crown Prince
sen.cmt: 内親王と区別するため変えました。
sen.e: The Consort of the Crown Prince

sen.j: 皇太孫
sen.e: The Son of the Crown Prince
The Son of the Crown Prince
The Son of the Crown Prince

sen.j: 皇太孫妃
sen.e: The Consort of the Crown Prince
The Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince
sen.cmt: 皇太子妃ではなく皇太孫妃です。
sen.e: The Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince

sen.j: 親王・親王妃・内親王・王 (皇族)・王妃 (皇族)・女王 (皇族)
sen.e: Imperial Princes, consorts of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, Empresses, and Queens.
Imperial Princes, Consorts of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, Consorts of Princes and Princesses.
sen.cmt: 皇后と区別するため変えました。
sen.e: Imperial Princes, Consorts of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, Consorts of Princes and Princesses.

sen.j: また、以上の順序の中でも細かな点については以下のようになっていた。
sen.e: Furthermore, details of the abovementioned Imperial ranking orders are given in the following:
Further details of the order were as follows:
Further details of the order were as follows:

sen.j: 親王・王の班位は、皇位継承の順序に従う。
sen.e: Imperial ranks of Imperial Princes and Princes followed the order of succession to the Imperial Throne.
Imperial ranks of Imperial Princes and Princes followed the order of succession to the Imperial Throne.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Imperial ranks of Imperial Princes and Princes followed the order of succession to the Imperial Throne.

sen.j: その順序は、以下のとおりである。
sen.e: The orders are listed in the following:
The order was as listed below:
The order was as listed below:

sen.j: 天皇の長子
sen.e: The eldest son of the Emperor.
The eldest son of the Emperor
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: The eldest son of the Emperor

sen.j: 天皇の長孫
sen.e: The first grandson of the Emperor.
The first grandson of the Emperor
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: The first grandson of the Emperor

sen.j: その他の天皇の長子の子孫
sen.e: Descendants of the eldest son by another Emperor.
Other descendants of the emperor's eldest son
sen.cmt: 内容が原文と異なっていました。ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Other descendants of the emperor's eldest son

sen.j: 天皇の次子及びその子孫
sen.e: The Emperor's second son or his descendants.
The Emperor's second son and his descendants
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。及びをandと訳しました。
sen.e: The Emperor's second son and his descendants

sen.j: その他の天皇の子孫
sen.e: Other descendants from the Emperor.
Other descendants of the Emperor
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。Fromをofに変えました。
sen.e: Other descendants of the Emperor

sen.j: 天皇の兄弟及びその子孫
sen.e: The Emperor's brothers or their descendants.
The Emperor's brothers and their descendants
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。及びをandと訳しました。
sen.e: The Emperor's brothers and their descendants

sen.j: 天皇の伯叔父及びその子孫
sen.e: The Emperor's uncle or his descendants.
The Emperor's uncle and his descendants
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。及びをandと訳しました。
sen.e: The Emperor's uncle and his descendants

sen.j: それ以上の皇族
sen.e: Other members of the Imperial family.
Other members of the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: Other members of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 以上においては、同等内では、嫡出及びその子孫の系統を先にして、庶出の子（非嫡出子）及びその子孫の系統を後にする。
sen.e: Among members of equal standing, legitimate sons and their male-line descendants have a stronger claim to succeed the Imperial Throne over those of illegitimate birth as well as their male-line descendants.
Among members of equal standing, legitimate sons and their male-line descendants had a stronger claim to succeed the Imperial Throne over those of illegitimate birth and their male-line descendants.
sen.cmt: 前半と語呂を合わせるため、as well asをandとしました。
sen.e: Among members of equal standing, legitimate sons and their male-line descendants had a stronger claim to succeed the Imperial Throne over those of illegitimate birth and their male-line descendants.

sen.j: また、嫡出子・庶出の子それぞれの中でも、先に生まれた者及びその子孫の系統を優先して、後に生まれた者及びその子孫の系統を後にする。
sen.e: Furthermore, even among the children of legitimate and of illegitimate birth, the first-born son and his male-line descendants take precedence over those sons and their male-line descendants who were born afterwards.

Furthermore, even among the children of legitimate and of illegitimate birth, the first-born son and his male-line descendants took precedence over those sons born afterwards and their male-line descendants.
sen.cmt: 意味が少し違ってました。
sen.e: Furthermore, even among the children of legitimate and of illegitimate birth, the first-born son and his male-line descendants took precedence over those sons born afterwards and their male-line descendants.

sen.j: （嫡庶長幼の順）
sen.e: The order of seniority between the children of legitimate and illegitimate birth
(Order of legibility and birth)
sen.cmt: 前文のピリオドの前に進入した方がいいと思います。
sen.e: (Order of legibility and birth)

sen.j: 内親王・女王の班位は、親王・王の班位に準じる。
sen.e: The Imperial ranks of Imperial Princesses and Princesses are pursuant to that of Imperial Princes and Princes.
The Imperial ranks of Imperial Princesses and Princesses were pursuant to that of Imperial Princes and Princes.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The Imperial ranks of Imperial Princesses and Princesses were pursuant to that of Imperial Princes and Princes.

sen.j: 親王・王・内親王・女王で同順位にある者は、男を先にし、女を後にする。
sen.e: Those who hold the ranking of either an Imperial Prince, Prince, Imperial Princess or Princess, and are positioned at the same order, male members take precedence over female members.
Among Imperial Princes, Princes, Imperial Princesses and Princess of equal rank, male members were ranked higher than their female counterparts.
Among Imperial Princes, Princes, Imperial Princesses and Princess of equal rank, male members were ranked higher than their female counterparts.

sen.j: （男女の順）
sen.e: Order of male and female members
(Order of gender)
sen.cmt: 前文のピリオドの前に進入した方がいいと思います。
sen.e: (Order of gender)

sen.j: 親王妃・王妃の班位は、夫の次とする。
sen.e: The Imperial ranks of the consorts of Imperial Princes and Empresses are second to their husbands'.
Consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes were ranked after their husbands.
Consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes were ranked after their husbands.

sen.j: 内親王・女王であって親王妃・王妃となった者も例外としない。
sen.e: No exceptions are made for those who were once Naishinno and Ohi and became Shinnohi and Ohi.
No exceptions were made for Imperial Princesses and Princess who became consorts to Imperial Princes and Princes.
sen.cmt: ローマ字表記を英語に変えました。
sen.e: No exceptions were made for Imperial Princesses and Princess who became consorts to Imperial Princes and Princes.

sen.j: 故皇太子の妃の班位は、皇太子妃の次とし、故皇太孫の妃の班位は、皇太孫妃の次とする。
sen.e: The Imperial ranks of the consort (widowed) of the late Crown Prince comes after that of the Crown Princess', and the Imperial ranks of the consort (widowed) of the late son of the Crown Prince is after that of the consort of the Crown Prince.
The widow of the late Crown Prince was ranked after the Consort of the Crown Prince, and the widow of the late Son of the Crown Prince was ranked after the Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: シンプルな表現に置き換えました。
sen.e: The widow of the late Crown Prince was ranked after the Consort of the Crown Prince, and the widow of the late Son of the Crown Prince was ranked after the Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince.

sen.j: 親王・王の寡妃（未亡人）の班位は、夫生存中と同じとする。
sen.e: The Imperial ranks of the widow of an Imperial Prince and Prince stays the same as to when their husbands were alive.
Widows of Imperial Princes and Princes retained their ranks after the deaths of their husbands.
sen.cmt: シンプルな表現に置き換えました。
sen.e: Widows of Imperial Princes and Princes retained their ranks after the deaths of their husbands.

sen.j: 摂政に就任している親王・内親王・王・女王の班位は、皇太孫妃の次とする。
sen.e: The Imperial ranks of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Princesses who have assumed the role of the regent (Sessho), are next in line to that of the consort of the son of the crown prince.
The Imperial ranks of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes and Princesses who had assumed the role of the regent (Sessho), followed that of the Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 不要なコンマを削除しました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: The Imperial ranks of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes and Princesses who had assumed the role of the regent (Sessho), followed that of the Consort of the Son of the Crown Prince.

sen.j: 但し、故皇太孫の妃があるときは、その次とする。
sen.e: However, if the consort of the late son of the Crown Prince is alive, then their Imperial ranks fall behind hers.
However, if there was a Consort of the late Son of the Crown Prince, then their Imperial ranks fell behind hers.
sen.cmt: 上記と一致するよう大文字を使いました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: However, if there was a Consort of the late Son of the Crown Prince, then their Imperial ranks fell behind hers.

sen.j: 皇太子・皇太孫が皇位継承の順序を変えられたときは、その班位は、皇太孫妃の次とする。
sen.e: In the case that the Crown Prince and the son of the Crown Prince have altered the order of succession to the Imperial Throne, then their Imperial ranks fall behind that of the consort of the son of the crown prince.

In the event that there was a change in the order of succession for the Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince, their Imperial ranks fell behind that of the Consort of the Son of the new Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: 原文通りに訳しましたが、分かりにくいと思います。私の理解ではこの段落は親王以下の皇族全員のことですが、文脈に上手く反映されていないと思います。
sen.e: In the event that there was a change in the order of succession for the Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince, their Imperial ranks fell behind that of the Consort of the Son of the new Crown Prince.

sen.j: 但し、故皇太孫の妃があるときはその次とし、摂政に就任している親王・内親王・王・女王があるときはその次とする。
sen.e: On the other hand, if the consort of the late son of the crown prince is alive, then their Imperial ranks come after hers, but if there are Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Princesses who have assumed the role of the Sessho, then their (the Crown Prince and the son of Crown Prince) ranks falls behind theirs.

However, if there was a Consort of the late Son of the Crown Prince, then their Imperial ranks fell behind hers, and if there were any Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes or Princesses who had assumed the role of regent, then their ranks fell behind theirs.
sen.cmt: 原文通りに訳しましたが、分かりにくいと思います。私の理解ではこの段落は（皇太子／皇太孫ではなく）親王以下の皇族全員のことですが、文脈に上手く反映されていないと思います。
sen.e: However, if there was a Consort of the late Son of the Crown Prince, then their Imperial ranks fell behind hers, and if there were any Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes or Princesses who had assumed the role of regent, then their ranks fell behind theirs.

sen.j: 親王・王が皇位継承の順序を変えられたときは、その班位は、順序変更前と同じとする。
sen.e: In the case when Imperial Princes and Princes have changed the order to the succession of the Imperial Throne, their Imperial ranks remain the same.
In the event that there was a change in the order of succession for the Imperial Princes and Princes, their Imperial ranks remained the same.
sen.cmt: 上文と同じスタイルにしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In the event that there was a change in the order of succession for the Imperial Princes and Princes, their Imperial ranks remained the same.

sen.j: 本来は王であるが、旧皇室典範制定前に親王宣下を受けて親王となっている者（宣下親王）は、宣下された順序によって、王の上とする。
sen.e: For those who were originally a Prince, but were conferred the title of an Imperial Prince before the implementation of the Former Imperial House Act (Imperially proclaimed as an Imperial Prince), are considered to be above a Prince in accordance with the order of the Imperial proclamation given.

Those who were originally Princes but had been conferred the title of Imperial Prince before the implementation of the former Imperial House Act (declared Imperial Princes) were ranked above Princes in order of conferrence.
sen.cmt: 大／小文字を修正しました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: Those who were originally Princes but had been conferred the title of Imperial Prince before the implementation of the former Imperial House Act (declared Imperial Princes) were ranked above Princes in order of conferrence.

sen.j: 現在の法令では法律たる皇室典範によってその範囲を定められた、皇統に属する天皇の一族を皇族とする。
sen.e: Under the existing law, the Emperor's family that belongs to the Imperial lineage pursuant to the extent defined by the legal power bestowed in the Imperial House Act is deemed to be the Imperial family.

Under the existing law, the Emperor's family that belongs to the Imperial lineage pursuant to the extent defined by the legal power bestowed in the Imperial House Act is deemed to be the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Under the existing law, the Emperor's family that belongs to the Imperial lineage pursuant to the extent defined by the legal power bestowed in the Imperial House Act is deemed to be the Imperial family.

sen.j: 皇族には天皇を含めず、天皇と皇族をあわせた全体を皇室という。
sen.e: The Emperor is not included in the Imperial family, and the combined whole of the Emperor and the Imperial family is called the Imperial household.
The Emperor is not included in the Imperial family, and the combined whole of the Emperor and the Imperial family is called the Imperial household.
The Emperor is not included in the Imperial family, and the combined whole of the Emperor and the Imperial family is called the Imperial household.

sen.j: 皇族の構成員は、皇后・太皇太后・皇太后・親王・親王妃・内親王・王 (皇族)・王妃 (皇族)・女王 (皇族)である（皇室典範5条）。
sen.e: The constituent members of the Imperial family are: The Empress, the Grand Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager, Imperial Princes, consorts of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Empresses (Article 5 of the Imperial House Act).

The constituent members of the Imperial family are: the Empress, the Grand Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager, Imperial Princes, Consorts of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Consorts of Princes and Princesses (Article 5 of the Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。皇后／王妃の区別ができるようにしました。女王を追加しました。「title」の一部となるよう、consortsも大文字としました。
sen.e: The constituent members of the Imperial family are: the Empress, the Grand Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager, Imperial Princes, Consorts of Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Consorts of Princes and Princesses (Article 5 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.j: この内、皇后・皇太后・皇太子・皇太子妃などとその独立していない子女の「天皇家」に属する皇族は内廷皇族と呼ばれ、「天皇家」から独立した宮家に属する皇族は宮家皇族と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Among these members, the Imperial family which includes the Empress, the Grand Empress Dowager, the Crown Prince, and the Crown Princess as well as the sons and daughters who are not independent but belong to the 'Emperor's family' are called the Inner Court Imperial family, and those members of the Imperial family such as the Miyakes (house of an imperial prince) who are independent of the 'Emperor's family' are called the Miyake Imperial family.

Among them, the 'Emperor's family' including the Empress, the Empress Dowager, the Crown Prince, the Crown Princess and their dependent sons and daughters is called the Inner Court Imperial family, and those who are independent and belong to Houses of Imperial Princes are called the Miyake Imperial family.

Among them, the 'Emperor's family' including the Empress, the Empress Dowager, the Crown Prince, the Crown Princess and their dependent sons and daughters is called the Inner Court Imperial family, and those who are independent and belong to Houses of Imperial Princes are called the Miyake Imperial family.

sen.j: 現行の皇室典範では、嫡出の皇子及び嫡男系嫡出の皇孫が親王・内親王とされ、三世以下の嫡男系嫡出の子孫は王・女王とされる（皇室典範6条）。
sen.e: According to the existing Imperial House Act, the Emperor's legitimate son and His grandchildren from a line of legitimate, male-line descendants are called Imperial Princes and Imperial Princesses, and descendants beyond the Emperor's grandchildren (third generation) who come from a line of male-line descendants are called Princes and Princesses (Article 6 of the Imperial House Act).

According to the existing Imperial House Act, the Emperor's legitimate son as well as grandchildren from his legitimate male-line descendants are called Imperial Princes and Imperial Princesses; descendants beyond the Emperor's grandchildren (third generation) from his legitimate male-line descendants are called Princes and Princesses (Article 6 of the Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。読みやすいよう区切りました。
sen.e: According to the existing Imperial House Act, the Emperor's legitimate son as well as grandchildren from his legitimate male-line descendants are called Imperial Princes and Imperial Princesses; descendants beyond the Emperor's grandchildren (third generation) from his legitimate male-line descendants are called Princes and Princesses (Article 6 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 非嫡出子は皇族とされない。
sen.e: Illegitimately born children are not recognized to be a part of the Imperial family.
Illegitimately born children are not recognized to be a part of the Imperial family.
Illegitimately born children are not recognized to be a part of the Imperial family.

sen.j: 天皇の母方の血族や姻族に関しては特別の規定がなく（上述の皇室親族令には規定があったが昭和22年に廃止）、民法の規定により、天皇の外戚の内、皇后から3親等内の者が天皇の姻族となる。
sen.e: There are no special provisions regarding the Emperor's maternal consanguinity or relatives by marriage (a provision existed in the aforementioned Ordinance of the Family of the Imperial Household, but it was abolished in 1947), and the Civil Codes stipulate that among the Emperor's maternal relatives, a member of kin within the third degree of relationship from the Empress is considered the Emperor's relative by affinity.

There are no special provisions regarding the Emperor's maternal consanguinity or relatives by marriage (a provision existed in the aforementioned Ordinance of the Family of the Imperial Household, but was abolished in 1947), and the Civil Codes stipulate that among the Emperor's in-laws, those within the third degree of relationship from the Empress are considered the Emperor's relatives by marriage.
sen.cmt: 単語を統一するためaffinityをmarriageとしました。不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: There are no special provisions regarding the Emperor's maternal consanguinity or relatives by marriage (a provision existed in the aforementioned Ordinance of the Family of the Imperial Household, but was abolished in 1947), and the Civil Codes stipulate that among the Emperor's in-laws, those within the third degree of relationship from the Empress are considered the Emperor's relatives by marriage.

sen.j: 天皇の姻族は皇族ではないが民法上は天皇の親族である。
sen.e: Although the Emperor's relatives by marriage are not a part of the Imperial family, under the Civil Codes, they are considered as the family members of the Emperor.
Although the Emperor's relatives by marriage are not a part of the Imperial family, under the Civil Codes, they are considered to be the Emperor's relatives.
sen.cmt: Consideredの使用を修正しました。
sen.e: Although the Emperor's relatives by marriage are not a part of the Imperial family, under the Civil Codes, they are considered to be the Emperor's relatives.

sen.j: このように皇族＝天皇の親族・血族というわけではない。
sen.e: Therefore, Imperial family does not necessarily mean the Emperor's family or consanguinity.
Therefore, being the Emperor's relative does not necessarily indicate membership in the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: ニュアンスが違うため、順序を変えました。
sen.e: Therefore, being the Emperor's relative does not necessarily indicate membership in the Imperial family.

sen.j: 皇族以外の親族には下記「一般国民と皇族の差異」は当てはまらないが、近親婚の禁止等の規制等は適用される。
sen.e: Although the following 'Differences between the General Public and the Imperial Family' does not apply to those family members that are not a part of the Imperial family, such provisions banning consanguineous marriages are applied.

Although the 'Differences between the General Public and the Imperial Family' below do not apply to those relatives that are not part of the Imperial family, certain provisions such as those banning consanguineous marriages do apply.
sen.cmt: Followingではないのでbelowとしました。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: Although the 'Differences between the General Public and the Imperial Family' below do not apply to those relatives that are not part of the Imperial family, certain provisions such as those banning consanguineous marriages do apply.

sen.j: 天皇又は親王・王の嫡出の子女として生まれた者以外が皇族となることができるのは、女子が天皇・親王・王 (皇族)のいずれかと結婚する場合のみに限られる（皇室典範15条）。
sen.e: The only way a person other than the legitimate son or daughter of either the Emperor, or Imperial Princes, or Princes to gain an Imperial status is limited only to the case when a woman marries either the Emperor, Imperial Princes or Princes (Article 15 of the Imperial House Act).

The only way a person other than the legitimate son or daughter of either the Emperor, an Imperial Prince or a Prince can gain Imperial status is when a woman marries either the Emperor, an Imperial Prince or a Prince (Article 15 of the Imperial House Act).

The only way a person other than the legitimate son or daughter of either the Emperor, an Imperial Prince or a Prince can gain Imperial status is when a woman marries either the Emperor, an Imperial Prince or a Prince (Article 15 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 満15歳以上の内親王・王・女王は、本人の意志に基づき、皇室会議の承認を経て、皇族の身分を離脱できる（皇室典範11条1項）。
sen.e: Based on their own will, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Princesses who are over the age of 15 can renounce their Imperial status through the approval from the Imperial Household Council (Clause 1, Article 11 of the Imperial House Act).

Based on their own will, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Princesses who are over the age of 15 can renounce their Imperial status through the approval of the Imperial Household Council (Clause 1, Article 11 of the Imperial House Act).

Based on their own will, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Princesses who are over the age of 15 can renounce their Imperial status through the approval of the Imperial Household Council (Clause 1, Article 11 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇太子・皇太孫を除く親王・内親王・王・女王は、やむを得ない特別の事由があるときは、本人の意思に関わらず、皇室会議の判断で、皇族の身分を離れる（皇室典範11条2項）。
sen.e: If there are compelling reasons- excluding the Crown Prince and the son of the Crown Prince-Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Princesses will renounce their Imperial status, regardless of their own will, by the discretion of the Imperial Household Council (Clause 2, Article 11 of the Imperial House Act).

If there are compelling reasons, Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes and Princesses – excluding the Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince – can lose their Imperial status regardless of the their own will, based on the decision made by the Imperial Household Council (Clause 2, Article 11 of the Imperial Household Act).
sen.cmt: “-”の前後にスペースを進入しました。Discretionをdecisionと変えました。
sen.e: If there are compelling reasons, Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes and Princesses – excluding the Crown Prince and the Son of the Crown Prince – can lose their Imperial status regardless of the their own will, based on the decision made by the Imperial Household Council (Clause 2, Article 11 of the Imperial Household Act).

sen.j: (1)皇族の身分を離れる親王・王の妃(2)皇族の身分を離れる親王・王の子孫(3)皇族の身分を離れる親王・王の子孫の妃は、その親王・王と同時に皇族の身分を離れる（他の皇族と婚姻した女子とその子孫を除く）。
sen.e: 1. Consorts of Imperial Princes or Princes who are renouncing their Imperial status, or 2. descendants of Imperial Princes or Princes who are renouncing their Imperial status, or 3. consorts of the descendants of Imperial Princes or Princes who are renouncing their Imperial status are to renounce their Imperial status simultaneously with those Imperial Princes and Princes (excluding the women who married other members of the Imperial family and her children).

The following members of the Imperial family lose their Imperial status upon an Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status: 1. Consort of Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status; 2. descendants of Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status; and 3. consorts of the descendants of Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status (excluding women who marry other members of the Imperial family and her children).
sen.cmt: 英語としてより自然な順序に置き換えました。
sen.e: The following members of the Imperial family lose their Imperial status upon an Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status: 1. Consort of Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status; 2. descendants of Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status; and 3. consorts of the descendants of Imperial Prince or Prince renouncing his Imperial status (excluding women who marry other members of the Imperial family and her children).

sen.j: 但し、(2)と(3)の皇族の身分を離れる親王・王の子孫とその妃については、皇室会議の判断で、皇族の身分を離れないものとすることができる（皇室典範13条）。
sen.e: However, regarding the descendants and consorts of descendants of Imperial Princes and Princes who are renouncing their Imperial status that were mentioned in 2 and 3, the Imperial Household Council can bar those members from renouncing their Imperial status through their discretion (Article 13 of the Imperial House Act).

However, regarding the descendants and consorts of descendants of Imperial Princes and Princes who are renouncing their Imperial status mentioned in above clauses 2 and 3, the Imperial Household Council can use their discretion to allow these members to retain their Imperial status (Article 13 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.e: However, regarding the descendants and consorts of descendants of Imperial Princes and Princes who are renouncing their Imperial status mentioned in above clauses 2 and 3, the Imperial Household Council can use their discretion to allow these members to retain their Imperial status (Article 13 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族女子は、天皇・皇族以外の者と結婚したときは、皇族の身分を離れる（皇室典範12条）。
sen.e: Female members of the Imperial family will renounce their Imperial status in the case they marry a member other than the Emperor or the Imperial family (Article 12 of the Imperial House Act).
If they marry anyone other than the Emperor or a member of the Imperial family, female members of the Imperial family lose their Imperial status (Article 12 of the Imperial House Act).
sen.cmt: 英語としてより自然な順序に置き換えました。
sen.e: If they marry anyone other than the Emperor or a member of the Imperial family, female members of the Imperial family lose their Imperial status (Article 12 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族以外の女子で親王妃又は王妃となった者が、その夫を失って未亡人（寡婦）となったときは、本人の意思により、皇族の身分を離脱できる。
sen.e: Female members other than the Imperial family who have become a consort of an Imperial Prince or a consort of a Prince (empress) through marriage, can renounce their Imperial status by their own will in the case when they are widowed.
When a woman not of Imperial background marries an Imperial Prince or Prince and is later widowed, she may, at her own will, renounce her Imperial status.
When a woman not of Imperial background marries an Imperial Prince or Prince and is later widowed, she may, at her own will, renounce her Imperial status.

sen.e: Furthermore, in cases of compelling reasons, they will renounce their Imperial status regardless of their own will through the discretion of the Imperial Household Council (Clause 2, Article 14 of the Imperial House Act).

Furthermore, in cases of compelling reasons, they will renounce their Imperial status regardless of their own will through the discretion of the Imperial Household Council (Clause 2, Article 14 of the Imperial House Act).

Furthermore, in cases of compelling reasons, they will renounce their Imperial status regardless of their own will through the discretion of the Imperial Household Council (Clause 2, Article 14 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.e: Female members other than the Imperial family who have become a consort of an Imperial Prince or a consort of a Prince (empress) through marriage, will renounce their Imperial status in the case of divorce (Clause 3, Article 14 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.e: When a woman not of Imperial background marries an Imperial Prince or Prince and later is divorced, she loses her Imperial status (Clause 3, Article 14 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.e: When female members who are descendants of Imperial Princes or Princes that have left their Imperial status marries another member of the Imperial family and is widowed, then they can renounce their Imperial status by the own will.

When a female descendant of an Imperial Prince or Prince who has renounced his Imperial status marries a member of the Imperial family and is later widowed, she may, at her own will, renounce her Imperial status.

sen.e: When a female descendant of an Imperial Prince or Prince who has renounced his Imperial status marries a member of the Imperial family and is later widowed, she may, at her own will, renounce her Imperial status.

sen.j: この場合、やむを得ない特別の事由があるときは、本人の意思に関わらず、皇室会議の判断で、皇族の身分を離れる。
sen.e: In cases of compelling reasons, they will renounce their Imperial status through the discretion of the Imperial Household Council regardless of their own will.

sen.e: In addition, they will renounce their Imperial status when they file for divorce (Clause 4, Article 14 of the Imperial House Act).
In addition, they lose their Imperial status when they get divorced (Clause 4, Article 14 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.j: 皇族男子は皇位継承資格を有する（皇室典範1,2条）。
sen.e: Male members of the Imperial family are qualified to succeed the Imperial Throne (Articles 1 and 2 of the Imperial House Act).
Male members of the Imperial family are qualified to succeed the Imperial Throne (Articles 1 and 2 of the Imperial House Act).
Male members of the Imperial family are qualified to succeed the Imperial Throne (Articles 1 and 2 of the Imperial House Act).
