sen.e: Members of the Imperial family, excluding consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes (empresses), who have reached the age of majority are qualified to assume the role of the regent and to vicariously execute state affairs on an extraordinary basis (Article 17 of the Imperial House Act and Article 2 of the Act for Extraordinary Vicarious Execution of State Affairs).

Members of the Imperial family, excluding consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes, who have reached the age of majority are qualified to assume the role of regent and to vicariously execute state affairs on an extraordinary basis (Article 17 of the Imperial House Act and Article 2 of the Act for Extraordinary Vicarious Execution of State Affairs).

Approval is necessary from the Imperial Household Council for a male member of the Imperial family to get married (Article 10 of the Imperial House Act).

sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。Within the inner courtが繰り返されてました。Miyakeを削除しました。Such asをbelonging toに変えました。
sen.e: Besides the professional positions within the Inner Court belonging to the Board of Chamberlains of the Imperial Household Agency and the Board of the Crown Prince's Affairs of the Imperial Household Agency, for each house of an Imperial prince there are professionals such as the Officer of the Imperial Prince's Household Affairs and Head of Lady's Maid (Specialized National Public Servants).

sen.j: 戦前の皇族身位令に準じて勲章 (日本)が行われ、戦後でも、成年に達したときや結婚の際に、親王には大勲位菊花大綬章が授けられ、親王妃・内親王には勲一等宝冠章（現、宝冠大綬章）が、王には勲一等旭日桐花大綬章（現、桐花大綬章）が、王妃・女王には勲二等宝冠章（現、宝冠牡丹章）が授けられる。
sen.e: Decoration of medals takes place (Japan) pursuant to the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility implemented in pre-War, and even after the War, members who had reached their majority or at the time of their marriage, the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum was bestowed to Imperial Princes; the First Order of the Precious Crown (currently, the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Precious Crown) to consorts of Imperial Princes and Imperial Princesses; Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower to (currently, the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Paulownia Flowers) to Princes; and Order of the Second Class of the Precious Crown (currently, The Order of the Precious Crown, Peony) to consorts of Princes and Queens.

Decoration of medals takes place (Japan), pursuant to the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility implemented pre-war, to mark their coming of age or marriage: the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum for Imperial Princes; the First Order of the Precious Crown (currently, the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Precious Crown) to Consorts of Imperial Princes and Imperial Princesses; Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower (currently, the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Paulownia Flowers) to Princes; and the Order of the Second Class of the Precious Crown (currently, the Order of the Precious Crown, Peony) to Consorts of Princes and Princesses.
sen.cmt: Inを削除しました。Warを小文字にしました。And even after the Warを削除しました。コンマを追加しました。Members who had~の表現を変えました。Theを追加しました。Toを削除しました。Consortsを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Decoration of medals takes place (Japan), pursuant to the Ordinance of the Imperial Nobility implemented pre-war, to mark their coming of age or marriage: the Grand Cordon of the Supreme Order of the Chrysanthemum for Imperial Princes; the First Order of the Precious Crown (currently, the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Precious Crown) to Consorts of Imperial Princes and Imperial Princesses; Grand Cordon of the Order of the Rising Sun with Paulownia Flower (currently, the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Paulownia Flowers) to Princes; and the Order of the Second Class of the Precious Crown (currently, the Order of the Precious Crown, Peony) to Consorts of Princes and Princesses.

sen.j: 現在の皇族は、以下の通りである。
sen.e: The Imperial family of today is shown below:
The Imperial family of today is as described below:
The Imperial family of today is as described below:

sen.j: 班位は、戦前の皇族身位令に準じる。
sen.e: The Imperial ranking order is pursuant to the provisions stipulated in the Ordinance of Imperial Nobility implemented in pre-War.
The Imperial ranking order is pursuant to the provisions stipulated in the Ordinance of Imperial Nobility implemented pre-war.
sen.cmt: Inを削除しました。Warを小文字にしました。
sen.e: The Imperial ranking order is pursuant to the provisions stipulated in the Ordinance of Imperial Nobility implemented pre-war.

sen.j: 但し、兄弟姉妹間では出生の順による。
sen.e: However, among the siblings, the ranking order is dependent on the order of their birth.
However, among siblings, the ranking order is dependent on the order of their births.
sen.cmt: Theを削除しました。Birthを複数にしました。
sen.e: However, among siblings, the ranking order is dependent on the order of their births.

sen.j: 皇統譜には宮号と称号は登録されない（宮内庁告示の形式によって官報で公表はされる）。
sen.e: On the Book of Imperial Lineage, the reigning name and the title are not registered (official announcements are made through an official gazette in accordance with the notification formality stipulated by the Imperial Household Agency).

On the Book of Imperial Lineage, the reigning name and the title are not registered (official announcements are made through an official gazette in accordance with the notification formality stipulated by the Imperial Household Agency).

On the Book of Imperial Lineage, the reigning name and the title are not registered (official announcements are made through an official gazette in accordance with the notification formality stipulated by the Imperial Household Agency).

sen.j: なお、宮号は天皇がその親王に賜るものであって、その親王のみがこれを称するものであり、当該親王の妃や子女等が自らの宮号としてこれを称することはない（たとえば、眞子内親王や寬仁親王は宮号を賜っていない）。
sen.e: Furthermore, the reigning name is something given by the Emperor to the concerned Imperial Prince, and the title is used only by that Imperial Prince; the consort of the Imperial Princes or his children and so on would not use the title for themselves (for example, Imperial Princess Mako and Imperial Prince Tomohito have not been given a reigning title).

Furthermore, the reigning name is something given by the Emperor to an Imperial Prince to be used only by that Imperial Prince; the consort of the Imperial Princes or his children and so on would not use the title for themselves (for example, Imperial Princess Mako and Imperial Prince Tomohito have not been given reigning titles).
sen.cmt: the concerned~の表現を変えました。Titlesを複数にしました。
sen.e: Furthermore, the reigning name is something given by the Emperor to an Imperial Prince to be used only by that Imperial Prince; the consort of the Imperial Princes or his children and so on would not use the title for themselves (for example, Imperial Princess Mako and Imperial Prince Tomohito have not been given reigning titles).

sen.j: 但し、上表では妃や子女等についても便宜のため括弧書きしている。
sen.e: However, on the chart above, reigning titles are given to consorts and children in parenthesis for the sake of convenience.
However, on the chart above, reigning titles are given to consorts and children in parentheses for the sake of convenience
However, on the chart above, reigning titles are given to consorts and children in parentheses for the sake of convenience

sen.j: 皇族の称呼は、内閣告示・宮内庁告示や官報の皇室事項欄では、歌会始などの特別な場合を除き、次のようになっている。
sen.e: The terms of address for members of the Imperial family (excepting for special cases such the first poetry-reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace), are officially announced on the Cabinet notification bulletin, the Imperial Household Agency notification bulletin, or on the column for Imperial affairs in official gazettes in the following way:

Members of the Imperial family are addressed in the Cabinet notification bulletins, the Imperial Household Agency notification bulletins or on the column for Imperial affairs in official gazettes (except for special cases such the first poetry-reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace) in the following way:
sen.cmt: 順序を変えました。コンマを削除しました。
sen.e: Members of the Imperial family are addressed in the Cabinet notification bulletins, the Imperial Household Agency notification bulletins or on the column for Imperial affairs in official gazettes (except for special cases such the first poetry-reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace) in the following way:

sen.j: 宮号や称号が表記されないことに注意が必要である。
sen.e: It needs to be called to attention the fact that the reigning names or titles are not written.
It should be noted that the reigning names or titles are not displayed.*The order is as it would appear in Japanese, the example is the English version.
sen.cmt: Called to attention~の表現を変えました。英語では呼称の順序が違うので、ここで説明を追加しました。
sen.e: It should be noted that the reigning names or titles are not displayed.*The order is as it would appear in Japanese, the example is the English version.

sen.j: 皇后・太皇太后・皇太后については、「皇后陛下」と、身位+敬称の順。
sen.e: For the Empress, Grand Empress Dowager, and the Empress Dowager, the order of their terms of address is expressed in the following manner: 'Her Imperial Majesty the Empress,' their Imperial nobility ＋their title of honor.

The Empress, Grand Empress Dowager and the Empress Dowager are addressed in the following manner: their Imperial nobility followed by their title of honor, for example 'Her Imperial Majesty the Empress.'
sen.cmt: ストレートな言い方にしました。＋を削除しました。英語の順序を分かりやすいよう変えました。
sen.e: The Empress, Grand Empress Dowager and the Empress Dowager are addressed in the following manner: their Imperial nobility followed by their title of honor, for example 'Her Imperial Majesty the Empress.'

sen.j: 皇太子については、「皇太子徳仁親王殿下」と、「皇太子」+名+身位+敬称の順。
sen.e: For the Crown Prince, the order of his term of address is expressed in the following manner: 'His Imperial Highness Crown Prince Naruhito,' and 'Crown Prince,' ＋his name ＋his Imperial nobility ＋title of honor.
The Crown Prince is addressed in the following manner: 'Crown Prince' followed by his name, his Imperial nobility and his title of honor, for example 'His Imperial Highness Crown Prince Naruhito.'
sen.cmt: ストレートな言い方にしました。＋を削除しました。英語の順序を分かりやすいよう変えました。
sen.e: The Crown Prince is addressed in the following manner: 'Crown Prince' followed by his name, his Imperial nobility and his title of honor, for example 'His Imperial Highness Crown Prince Naruhito.'

sen.j: 皇太子妃については、「皇太子徳仁親王妃雅子殿下」と、「皇太子」+夫の名+夫の身位+「妃」+名+敬称の順。
sen.e: For the Crown Princess, the order of her term of address is expressed in the following manner: 'Their Imperial Highnesses the Crown Prince Naruhito and Crown Princess Masako,' and 'Crown Prince' ＋husband's name ＋husband's Imperial nobility ＋'Princess' ＋her name ＋title of honor.

The Crown Princess is addressed in the following manner: 'Crown Prince' followed by husband's name, husband's Imperial nobility, 'Consort,' her name and title of honor, for example 'Her Imperial Highness Masako the Consort to Crown Prince Naruhito.'
sen.cmt: ストレートな言い方にしました。＋を削除しました。英語の順序を分かりやすいよう変えました。
sen.e: The Crown Princess is addressed in the following manner: 'Crown Prince' followed by husband's name, husband's Imperial nobility, 'Consort,' her name and title of honor, for example 'Her Imperial Highness Masako the Consort to Crown Prince Naruhito.'

sen.j: 親王・内親王・王・女王については、「文仁親王殿下」や「愛子内親王殿下」と、名+身位+敬称の順。
sen.e: For Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes, and Queens, the order of their terms of address is expressed in the following manner in the examples of: 'His Imperial Highness Imperial Prince Fumihito' or 'Her Imperial Highness Imperial Princess Aiko,' and their names＋their Imperial nobility ＋title of honor.

Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes and Princesses are addressed in the following manner: their names, their Imperial nobility and title of honor, for example 'His Imperial Highness Imperial Prince Fumihito' or 'Her Imperial Highness Imperial Princess Aiko.'
sen.cmt: ストレートな言い方にしました。＋を削除しました。英語の順序を分かりやすいよう変えました。
sen.e: Imperial Princes, Imperial Princesses, Princes and Princesses are addressed in the following manner: their names, their Imperial nobility and title of honor, for example 'His Imperial Highness Imperial Prince Fumihito' or 'Her Imperial Highness Imperial Princess Aiko.'

sen.j: 親王妃・王妃については、「文仁親王妃紀子殿下」と、夫の名+夫の身位+「妃」+名+敬称の順。
sen.e: For consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes (empresses), the order of their terms of address is expressed in the following manner: 'Their Imperial Highnesses Prince Fumihito and Princess Kiko,' and husband's name ＋ husband's Imperial nobility ＋ 'Princess' ＋her name ＋title of honor.

Consorts of Imperial Princes or Princes are addressed in the following manner: husband's name, husband's Imperial nobility, 'Consort,' her name and title of honor, for example "Her Imperial Highness Kiko Consort to Prince Fumihito.'
sen.cmt: ストレートな言い方にしました。＋を削除しました。英語の順序を分かりやすいよう変えました。
sen.e: Consorts of Imperial Princes or Princes are addressed in the following manner: husband's name, husband's Imperial nobility, 'Consort,' her name and title of honor, for example "Her Imperial Highness Kiko Consort to Prince Fumihito.'

sen.j: 皇族が「崩御」ないし「死死の表現」した後は、「故皇太后」や「故宣仁親王妃喜久子」と、上記に「故」が冠され敬称が省かれる。
sen.e: After a member of an Imperial family has passed away by either taking the forms of 'hogyo' or 'The Expression of Death', the prefix of 'Late' is added by omitting the title of honor which are shown in the examples of 'the Late Empress Dowager, ' or 'the Late Princess Kikuko.'
After a member of an Imperial family has passed away, the prefix of 'Late' is added and the title of honor is omitted, for example 'the Late Empress Dowager' or 'the Late Princess Kikuko.'
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。崩御等は内容に関係ないので削除しました。Added byは不適切なので、andとしました。
sen.e: After a member of an Imperial family has passed away, the prefix of 'Late' is added and the title of honor is omitted, for example 'the Late Empress Dowager' or 'the Late Princess Kikuko.'

sen.j: 夫が「薨去」して未亡人となった場合でも、親王妃や王妃の称呼については「憲仁親王妃久子殿下」と、夫の名に「故」を冠さない。
sen.e: Regarding the terms of address for the widowed consorts of Imperial Princes or Princes (empresses), the prefix of 'Late' will not be added to their husband's name which is shown in the case of 'Her Imperial Highness Princess Hisako, the wife of Imperial Prince Norihito.'

Even after their husbands have passed away, Consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes are addressed in the same manner without adding the prefix 'Late' to the husband's name, for example 'Her Imperial Highness Hisako Consort to Imperial Prince Norihito.'
sen.cmt: 上文と同じスタイルにしました。
sen.e: Even after their husbands have passed away, Consorts of Imperial Princes and Princes are addressed in the same manner without adding the prefix 'Late' to the husband's name, for example 'Her Imperial Highness Hisako Consort to Imperial Prince Norihito.'

sen.j: 法律や叙勲においては、「皇太子徳仁親王の結婚の儀の行われる日を休日とする法律」など、敬称は省かれる。
sen.e: The usage of the title of honor under the name of a law or upon conferring a decoration will be omitted which is shown in the case of 'The Act Decreeing the Wedding Ceremony of Crown Prince Naruhito as a Holiday.'
Titles of honor are omitted in the name of a law or upon conferring a decoration, for example 'The Act Decreeing the Day of Crown Prince Naruhito's Wedding Ceremony a Holiday.'
sen.cmt: Willは未来形なのでisに変えました。
sen.e: Titles of honor are omitted in the name of a law or upon conferring a decoration, for example 'The Act Decreeing the Day of Crown Prince Naruhito's Wedding Ceremony a Holiday.'

sen.j: 皇族の班位は、ほぼ戦前の皇族身位令に準じるものとなっているが、兄弟姉妹間では、女よりも男を優先する場合と、男女関係なく出生順による場合とが見られる。
sen.e: Although the Imperial ranking order for members of the Imperial family is in most part pursuant to the Ordinance of Imperial Nobility implemented in pre-War, among the siblings, there are cases where the male members take precedence over the female members, and those where the order of birth is weighed more heavily regardless of gender.

Although the Imperial ranking order for members of the Imperial family is in most part pursuant to the Ordinance of Imperial Nobility implemented pre-war, among siblings, there are cases where the male members take precedence over the female members, and those where the order of birth is weighed more heavily regardless of gender.
sen.cmt: Inを削除しました。Warを小文字にしました。
sen.e: Although the Imperial ranking order for members of the Imperial family is in most part pursuant to the Ordinance of Imperial Nobility implemented pre-war, among siblings, there are cases where the male members take precedence over the female members, and those where the order of birth is weighed more heavily regardless of gender.

sen.j: 前者の例として、昭和41年（1966年）の歌会始において三笠宮崇仁親王の子である近衛やす子（1944年生）が、彼女よりも出生順では後の寬仁親王（1946年生）の後の席次となっている例がある。
sen.e: As an example of the former, at the first poetry-reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace in 1966, the seating order of the daughter of Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito, Yasuko KONOE (born 1944), came after Imperial Prince Tomohito's (born 1946).

As an example of the former, at the first poetry reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace in 1966, the seating order of the daughter of Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito, Yasuko KONOE (born 1944), came after Imperial Prince Tomohito's (born 1946).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。-を削除しました。
sen.e: As an example of the former, at the first poetry reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace in 1966, the seating order of the daughter of Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito, Yasuko KONOE (born 1944), came after Imperial Prince Tomohito's (born 1946).

sen.j: 後者の例としては、昭和52、53年（1977年、1978年）の歌会始において、同じく三笠宮崇仁親王の子である千容子（1951年生）が、出生順どおり高円宮憲仁親王 （1954年生）の前となっている例がある。
sen.e: As an example of the latter, at the first poetry-reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace in 1977 and 1978, similarly the daughter of Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito, Masako SEN (born 1951), was seated before Takamadonomiya Imperial Prince Norihito (born 1954) in accordance to the order of their birth.

As an example of the latter, at the first poetry reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace in 1977 and 1978, another daughter of Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito, Masako SEN (born 1951), was seated before Takamadonomiya Imperial Prince Norihito (born 1954) in accordance to the order of their birth.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。-を削除しました。Similarlyをanotherとしました。
sen.e: As an example of the latter, at the first poetry reading party of the New Year at the Imperial Palace in 1977 and 1978, another daughter of Mikasanomiya Imperial Prince Takahito, Masako SEN (born 1951), was seated before Takamadonomiya Imperial Prince Norihito (born 1954) in accordance to the order of their birth.
